(OOC) I sure make a habit of the OOC beginnings, yes? Anyhoo, I was 
curiou=
s if the board usually gets even MORE active on weekends of not=85
Just so =
I know if I should check in more than twice daily. 

(IC) Flashing a bright=
 steel grin, Skullhammer nods in agreement. The 
smaller transformer, indee=
d less aggressive for the moment than 
Crotale, seems to be a relatively we=
lcoming sort of bot. His voice, 
resonant and full, intones his answer. "Th=
ank you. Yes, big I am. 
With this new form, I don't expect many of the Pre=
ds or Decepticons 
on this planet to have much to say when I come into the =
fray. 
Skullhammer's my name, by the way." With a curious gesture, 
Skullha=
mmer asks in kind what Crossroads' alternate form is, 
considering the tran=
sformer is so much smaller than the massive 
elephant. 

The elephantine tr=
ansformer, still in beast mode, takes up stride 
with the pair of Pacifix a=
nd Crossroads. Considering the advantages 
of shifting, the large creature =
attempts to bring a transformation 
about. With a powerful flexing of his m=
etallic muscles, Skullhammer 
realigns a myriad of parts to quickly stand b=
efore them in robot 
mode. In truth, the cannons on his arm must appear men=
acing to 
someone not expecting the simple silvery-grey elephant to appear =

armed with twin cannons built on the sides of his arms. He quickly 
disarm=
s them so as not to cause any unrest, and the cannons swivel 
back off the =
top of his forearm to the side, and then backwards by 
his elbow. 

Skullha=
mmer again flashes the same smile, a sort of uncaring and 
honest smile tha=
t can easily show his lack of desire to cause any 
trouble. His bright blue=
 eyes light up as he sees the familiar style 
of base and equipment, having=
 been stuck in a Maximal beast training 
facility for the last three earth =
months. His chest features the 
Autobot insignia prominently (much like Lio=
convoy features the 
Maximal/Cybertron logo) in a brilliant red. Most of hi=
s accenting 
parts are a red of some shade. 

His strides soon take the sam=
e rhythm of Pacifix's footfalls, and he 
treads along the Autobot compound =
with quieter steps. As an elephant, 
his four feet make a thunderous racket=
. As a robot, his regular legs 
make a less violent din, even on metal or c=
oncrete. He follows 
Pacifix and Crossroads and waits to see what happens. =
